likert_series.prompt: PartI: A list of opposing words appears below. Rate how well these words describe your feelings about chemistry. Think carefully and try not to include your feelings toward chemistry teachers or chemistry courses. For each line, choose a position between the two words that describes exactly how you feel. The middle position (4) is if you are undecided or have no feelings related to the terms on that row. Your answers should finish the statement:
Indicate the extent to which you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.

item.prompt: I feel like I "belong" in chemistry.
I feel welcomed in my chemistry class.
I do not have much in common with other students in my chemistry class.

prompt.p: On average, about how much time per week did you spend using the OLI materials?

open_response.prompt: How do you currently describe your gender identity?

multiple_choice.prompt: Which categories describe you? Select all that apply to you: your racial or ethnic heritage?
multiple_choice.choice: American Indian or Alaska Native—For example, Navajo Nation, Blackfeet Tribe, Mayan, Aztec, Native Village of Barrow Inupiat Traditional Government, Nome Eskimo Community
Asian—For example, Chinese, Filipino, Asian Indian, Vietnamese, Korean, Japanese
Black or African American—For example, Jamaican, Haitian, Nigerian, Ethiopian, Somalian
Hispanic, Latino or Spanish Origin—For example, Mexican or Mexican American, Puerto Rican, Cuban, Salvadoran, Dominican, Columbian
Middle Eastern or North African—For example, Lebanese, Iranian, Egyptian, Syrian, Moroccan, Algerian
Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander—For example, Native Hawaiian, Samoan, Chamorro, Tongan, Fijian, Marshallese
White—For example, German, Irish, English, Italian, Polish, French
Some other race, ethnicity, or origin, please specify: ___________
